data: Indications:  - Diagnosis of ischemic stroke causing measurable neurological deficit AND Patient has been assessed by a  neurologist  - CT scan performed and read  - Patient can be transported if necessary and alteplase treatment can be initiated  within 4.5 hours of a well established symptom onset

Absolute Contraindications:   - History of intracranial hemorrhage, neoplasm, vascular malformation (except meningioma), or aneurysm   - Stroke, intracranial surgery, or head injury within 3 months   - Arterial puncture at a non-compressible site within 7 days   - Symptoms of stroke suggestive of subarachnoid hemorrhage   - Witnessed seizure with postictal residual neurological impairments unless clearly attributable to acute stroke   - Evidence of active bleeding or acute trauma (fracture) on examination   - Acute bleeding diathesis  - Persistent hypertension (BP greater than 185/110) despite treatment  - Anticoagulant use within 48 hours and a prolonged PTT and / or INR greater than 1.7 OR (see below if patient presents 3 to 4.5 hours post onset of stroke symptoms)  - Platelet count less than 100,000 x 109/L    - Blood glucose less than 2.7 mmol/L or greater than 22 mmol/L   - CT changes showing major extensive early infarct signs  - Evidence of intracranial hemorrhage on pre-treatment noncontrast head CT

Relative Contraindications:  - Recent acute myocardial infarction (within previous 3 months)  - Neurological signs clearing spontaneously; signs minor and isolated  - Pregnancy  - Age less than 18 years  - Within 14 days of major surgery or serious trauma (see below if patient presents 3 to 4.5 hours post onset of stroke symptoms)  - Recent gastrointestinal or urinary tract hemorrhage (within previous 21 days)  - Post myocardial infarction pericarditis or aortic dissection

Precautions within 3 to 4.5 hours following onset of stroke symptoms:  - Oral anticoagulant treatment  - Age greater than 80 years  - Severe hemispheric stroke as assessed clinically (NIHSS score greater than 25) or a stroke with major early infarct CT signs involving more than one third of the middle cerebral artery territory  - Combination of previous stroke and diabetes mellitus  - Major surgery or trauma within the previous 3 months
If patient displays the following symptoms:
q1h for 8 hour including assessment for angioedema (tongue swelling) at initiation of alteplase then reassess
For 24 hours post alteplase administration and physician to reassess within 12 to 24 hours of alteplase administration
Do not elevate, Ischemic stroke / TIA and NOT at risk of aspiration or oxygen desaturation
30 degrees, Refractory high blood pressure, large completed ischemic infarct, elevated intracranial pressure
For 3 hours post alteplase administration then reassess
No heparin, warfarin, ASA, ticlopidine, ticagrelor, or clopidogrel for the first 24 hours after alteplase administration
No IM injections or heparin, warfarin, ASA, ticlopine, ticagrelor, or clopidogrel for the first 24 hours after alteplase (tPA) administration
These alteplase orders represents a total dose of 0.9 mg/kg, with 10% given as a loading dose and the remainder as continuous infusion.
